Hi,

in http://www.robotstxt.org/wc/guidelines.html
one of the guidelines says:

Use If-modified-since or HEAD where possible 
  If your application can use the HTTP If-modified-since 
  header, or the HEAD method for its purposes, that 
  gives less overhead than full GETs. 

It seems heritrix does neither. At leas I could not find any
code in head that would indicate the spider uses one
of those.

This is a problem for me, because I want to do incremental 
updates of spider runs. To do such an update there is no 
need to fetch a page that has already been fetched.

Nor does it use HTTP/1/1 ETag  
  http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.19

Am I missing something here??

Michael
